p: For Sanger sequencing of evolved populations, the resulting PCR fragments were purified using a mixture of 1ul of Exonuclease I ( Exo1; NEB), 1ul Alkaline phosphatase (NEB), and 1ul of Alkaline phosphatase buffer (NEB) and incubated at 37°C for 20 min followed by 80°C for an additional 20 min. Sequencing was performed via dye termination (Sanger) at the Yale University DNA Analysis Facility at Science Hill using primers listed in Appendix S1. Sequence processing and genome assembly were performed in Geneious 11.1.4 ( http://www.geneious.com), and polymorphic sites were confirmed by visual inspection of chromatograms. The resulting sequence represented the population consensus genome. Variable sites within a sample were identified as secondary peaks. However, minority variants were likely missed by this approach, since only high frequency variants were detectable (Remold et al., 2008). Consensus sequences of evolved populations were aligned with each other and with the consensus sequences from the ancestral 37°C and random populations from Alto et al., ( 2013).
